Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "The Pianist" (2002) from this list: ['Redacted', 'Passion', 'The End of the Affair', 'The Pianist'].
"The Pianist" is a gripping historical drama film that revolves around the life of Wladyslaw Szpilman, a Polish musician who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1996.
Set during World War II, "The Pianist" tells the story of Szpilman's journey from being a prominent composer and pianist to becoming a refugee after surviving a Holocaust concentration camp.
Through his piano performances, Szpilman manages to convey the emotional weight of his experiences in the concentration camps.
As a result of his performances, Szpilman is able to gain recognition for his experiences as a Holocaust survivor.
In conclusion, "The Pianist" is a gripping historical drama film that revolves around the life of Wladyslaw Szpilman, a Polish musician who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1996.

conversation.text: Based on your preferences, I would recommend checking out "The Equalizer" (2014). This action-packed thriller stars Denzel Washington as a former military police officer who now operates his own private detective agency. The movie follows the cases of two clients, one of whom is a wealthy businessman who has been wrongly accused of murder by a rival businessman. The other client is a young woman who has been kidnapped and forced to work in an illegal sex trafficking ring operating out of Mexico. As Private Detective Jack McCallum (Washington) investigates the cases of his clients, he must navigate a complex web of corruption, greed, and power struggles that threaten not only his own career, but also the lives and well-being of his two clients.
